_header: God that all this world hath wrought
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 499.5; for other MSS with a different Prologue or none at all, see 3247 and 5268.
_description: Storia Lune: the several days of the month, the Biblical characters born on each, etc., with a Prologue of 52 lines.

BodDig88.First Lines:
God that all thys worlde hath wroughtAnd all mankynde wiþ hys
                    blod bought…
BodDig88.Last Lines:
…That day also ys tyme gudeyff you wilte blede veyne
                    blode

CamTCC600.First Lines:
God þat al þis worlde haþe wroughtAnd al mankynde
                    with his blood bought…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…ffor as by doctryne þat haþe been taughtso is truwe
                    ne douteþe it naught
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
And heere nowe filowing bigynneþe a weele compyled thing in wyse of
                    deestynarye And of ouþer behoouely gouuernaunces touching þe goode
                    tale of mannes heele studyed and laboured by gret philosofres and clerkes of
                    olde tyme beholdeþe and reedeþe (p. 235); A dyetarie for mans heele
                    (RT)

BLHar1735.First Lines:
God þat all þis world hays wroutȝAnd all mankynd
                    with hys blod bowtȝ…
BLHar1735.Last Lines:
…Þat day also is tyme godYef þu wyltȝ bledun
                    weyn blod
BLHar1735.Note: Folio number reflects the most recent foliation.

HunHM64.First Lines:
GOde that all this worlde wroughteAnd all mankynde withe his blode
                    bowghte…
HunHM64.Last Lines:
…To send vs happe and graceAnd hye in heveyn to have a
                    place
